# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. There was a brief exchange about finding the updated Hyperfy quickstart documentation link, which was promptly provided. Another discussion touched on exporting VRM models with blendshapes in Blender, specifically addressing the limitation of the VRM plugin only allowing blendshapes to be applied to one mesh at a time. A user questioned whether this was accurate, noting that avatars often use separate opaque and transparent meshes. Finally, a user named Valiant briefly mentioned making progress toward an upcoming "race day" without specific technical details.

## 2. FAQ
Q: What's the new Hyperfy quickstart installation link? (asked by emotionull) A: https://docs.hyperfy.xyz/welcome/quickstart/ (answered by maximus)
Q: Has anyone been successful in exporting generated VRMs with blendshapes through Blender? (asked by lucii.io) A: Partially answered by Ashxn who believed Blender VRM supported blendshapes on more than one mesh
Q: Is it possible to edit the script to accommodate more than one mesh? (asked by lucii.io) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: maximus | Helpee: emotionull | Context: User needed the updated Hyperfy quickstart documentation link | Resolution: Provided the correct URL
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: lucii.io | Context: User was having issues with Blender VRM plugin only allowing blendshapes on one mesh at a time | Resolution: Partial help by suggesting the plugin should support multiple meshes, citing common avatar setups

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Investigate editing the VRM plugin script to support blendshapes on multiple meshes | Description: Current limitation in Blender VRM plugin prevents applying blendshapes to more than one mesh at a time | Mentioned By: lucii.io

The chat segment is extremely brief, consisting of only two messages. Maximus shared a link to a Coinbase Developer Platform page about "x402" with an expression of surprise ("Holy moly"). Ashxn responded with a one-word acknowledgment ("crazy"). There is no substantive technical discussion, problem-solving, or implementation details in this exchange.

# Analysis of ðŸ§Šâ”‚3d-design Channel

## 1. Summary:
The conversation revolves around Hyperfy's transition from v1 to v2 platform. A user (carlosmu) inquires about creating a new world in Hyperfy v1, but learns that v1 world NFTs are no longer available as the platform is transitioning to v2. Ashxn explains that while v1 is in maintenance mode and still functional, no major updates are planned. For v2, users have several options: self-hosting the open-source v2 world engine, using a hosting service like hyperworld.host, building locally, or using play.hyperfy.xyz where everyone has build permissions. The documentation has moved from hyperfy.how to docs.hyperfy.xyz, and a roadmap for v2 is coming soon.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Can I create a new world/land in Hyperfy v1? (asked by carlosmu) A: The v1 world NFTs are no longer available as Hyperfy is transitioning to a new v2 engine and platform. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Can I buy a world in opensea? (asked by carlosmu) A: Yes, but the v1 platform is in maintenance mode with no more major updates, though it still works. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there any chance to try the v2 builder? (asked by carlosmu) A: Yes, the v2 world engine is open source and can be self-hosted or used via a hosting service like hyperworld.host. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Can we build locally? (asked by carlosmu) A: Absolutely. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is this the right link for v2 docs? (asked by carlosmu) A: The docs moved to https://docs.hyperfy.xyz. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is play.hyperfy.xyz v1 or v2 infrastructure? (asked by carlosmu) A: v2. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there a roadmap for the release of v2? (asked by carlosmu) A: Roadmap coming soon! (answered by Ashxn)

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: carlosmu | Context: User wanted to create a new world in Hyperfy but was unaware of v1 to v2 transition | Resolution: Explained current status and provided multiple alternatives for building in v2
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: carlosmu | Context: User needed updated documentation links | Resolution: Provided correct link to v2 documentation (docs.hyperfy.xyz) and mentioned play.hyperfy.xyz as a building option

## 4. Action Items:
Technical: Check out self-hosting options for v2 world engine | Description: For developers who want to start building in v2 | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Technical: Explore building in play.hyperfy.xyz | Description: Alternative to self-hosting where everyone has build permissions | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Documentation: Review updated v2 documentation at docs.hyperfy.xyz | Description: New location for Hyperfy documentation | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Feature: Watch for upcoming v2 roadmap | Description: Roadmap for v2 release is coming soon | Mentioned By: Ashxn
